means: 使习惯于( habituate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: From his childhood , Jack has habituated himself to getting up early.
sentence.Network_cn: 杰克从小就习惯于早起.

sentence.Network_en: They are habituated to hard work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们习惯于艰苦的工作.

entry.def: If you are habituated to something, you have become used to it.

example.ex: People in the area are habituated to the idea of learning from the person above how to do the work...
example.tran: 该地区的人们习惯于向上级学习如何工作。

example.ex: More people are habituated to cigarettes than to drugs or alcohol in this country.
example.tran: 在这个国家，烟民比瘾君子或酒鬼要多。

auth_sentence.content: School had habituated Francis to shabbiness and discomfort and stinks.
auth_sentence.res_content: School had habituated Francis to shabbiness and discomfort and stinks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: School had habituated Francis to shabbiness and discomfort and stinks.

auth_sentence.content: We love everything that we are habituated with.
auth_sentence.res_content: We love everything that we are habituated with.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We love everything that we are habituated with.

auth_sentence.content: Let's say that I have habituated myself to loving my neighbour.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's say that I have habituated myself to loving my neighbour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's say that I have habituated myself to loving my neighbour.
